title: What is the easiest industry to get into: music or films? - Quora

response.answer_text: At the risk of being rude, if you’re looking for “easy,” you shouldn’t be attempting to go into either. When people say it’s really hard to make a living in those industries, they’re right. Jobs are few, you have to work long hours, and do a lot of work for free. So, if you want to go into the arts, you need to have a burning passion. You must be compelled to write, to play, or to work your bloody ass off because you like working your bloody ass off doing that specific thing. I say this because you’ll have to wade through a lot of crap, and only that passion will keep you going. But, if you really wanted to press me for an answer, I’d say that you’re more likely to find work in the film business, in certain cities with a strong film industry, because there are simply more positions available: catering, runner, driver, construction, assistant … However, not all of those positions pay a living wage. Want to be a production assistant on a no-budget indie short? Sure! You’re in the industry! But will you get paid? Maybe you’ll be on a “deferred” salary, where you get paid if the film sells. Heh. Heh. Do what you love. Do what gets you up in the morning. Do it because you are driven to do it. But don’t do it because it’s “easier.”

Has to be film. Lots more unskilled and semi skilled jobs there from catering, through lighting, and research, or even walk on extra parts. For music there are far fewer such positions. And I wish certain promoters and producers would develop more skill as well.
